items.title: Russian general killed by car bomb in Moscow, officials say
items.summary: The explosion killed lieutenant general Fanil Sarvarov in Moscow about 6:55am local time (2.55pm AEDT) on Monday.

items.title: 'Tinderbox' could set fire: Minns defends protest ban amid 'kneejerk' criticism
items.summary: Critics say the proposed reforms following the Bondi terror attack are "draconian" and "kneejerk anti-protest laws".

items.title: 'It started out as a joke': Why this NRL star is looking at the skies
items.summary: The quiet pastime of birdwatching is taking flight online, linking enthusiasts beyond the outdoors.

items.title: Police charge man over alleged 'violent call to action' at beach
items.summary: The man has been charged with using a carriage service to menace, harass, offend and publicly threaten violence on grounds of race or religion.

items.title: What is collective grief? How Australians are mourning the Bondi attack together
items.summary: Following the Bondi Beach terror attack, people are coming together in Australia and around the world in grief.

items.title: Mandy thought she had a gastro bug. Three days later, she was in an induced coma
items.summary: For some people who have experienced life-threatening situations, it's not the situation itself that has the longest-lasting impact — it's the aftermath.

items.title: How the Bondi Beach terror attack could change protest laws
items.summary: NSW Premier Chris Minns says protests are "unleashing forces" organisers can't control, but critics say the proposals are an overreach.

items.title: 'Under-16 refugees': Will this platform see another new wave of users after the social media ban?
items.summary: With under-16s now excluded from many of their favourite social media apps, alternative platforms remain available, especially for bilingual teens.

items.title: Israel approves 19 new West Bank settlements aimed at 'blocking' a Palestinian state
items.summary: Israel said the 19 newly approved settlements are located in what it described as "highly strategic" areas.

items.title: US coast guard in 'pursuit' of another oil tanker near Venezuela
items.summary: The first oil tanker was seized by US forces on 10 December and a second one was "apprehended" on 20 December.

items.title: Nine killed, 10 injured in South Africa in second mass shooting this month
items.summary: South Africa, Africa's biggest economy, has one of the world's highest murder rates, averaging about 60 a day.

items.title: PM orders review into federal police and intelligence agencies after Bondi terror attack
items.summary: The review will examine whether the agencies "have the right powers, structures, processes and sharing arrangements in place".

items.title: From fringe to frontline: How Australia's far right gained mainstream attention in 2025
items.summary: From extremist fringes to the Senate, the far-right opportunistically dug their claws into Australian society and discourse this year.

items.title: Jamie followed his dad's 14,000km England-to-Australia bike ride — here's how it went
items.summary: Jamie Hargreaves retraces his father's 1984 journey from England to Australia, adapting the route across Europe and Asia.

items.title: Thousands gather at Bondi vigil; PM orders security agency review as calls for royal commission grow — as it happened
items.summary: Thousands of mourners gathered at Bondi Beach for a vigil, marking one week since a terror attack killed 15 people.

items.title: 'People are raging': Trump facing backlash from within over Epstein file redactions
items.summary: A limited release of the Epstein files has angered Republicans and Democrats alike.

items.title: NSW premier calls for royal commission, pledges to ban 'globalise the intifada' chant
items.summary: Anthony Albanese suggested he would support a royal commission into the Bondi attack if the NSW government does.

items.title: In Switzerland, some workers commute by floating down a river. Could Australians do the same?
items.summary: Swiss workers and families swim in city rivers during summer. Could greater access to urban swimming be on the cards for Australians?

items.summary: Some Pakistani Australians say the false identification of one of the alleged Bondi attackers has had a serious impact on their lives.

items.title: United States launches retaliatory strikes against IS group targets in Syria
items.summary: The ‍Syrian government fully supported the United States' strikes against IS group targets in Syria, US President Donald Trump said.

items.title: 'We're changing lives': This small Sydney bakery gave Ben more than a job
items.summary: At a small bakery in Sydney, asylum seekers and refugees find more than work — they find hope, belonging and a chance to rebuild their lives.

items.title: Epstein files show Clinton, Mick Jagger and Michael Jackson — but Trump noticeably absent
items.summary: More than 300,000 pages of records from the investigation into late financier and convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein have been released.
